intro: Centaurea coronata, commonly known as the Crowned Daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features bright yellow flowers surrounded by a ring of blue to purple bracts, giving it its common name. It grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Centaurea coronata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
